messages.message:
Hi team, I'm seeing an unexpected issue with the search functionality in the Explorer app on the IB platform. The search functionality only seems to work for expanded folders or at the base level. What I mean by this is that I cannot search for files or folders that are nested in other folders, unless I have already expanded them previously.

For example, I have a file called `reduce_udf.udf` that is nested in the `.instabase_projects` folder. If I search for it, nothing will come up. However if I expand the folders and reveal the file then the search will work as expected. To go one step further - if I now collapse the folder again, the context is kept and the search will still work.

Is this a known issue?

I wish it worked the way you're describing, but unfortunately it can't - it's more of a filter than a search really. It's all done on the frontend by looking through the nodes that are already loaded. It's most useful if you have a long list of files and you're looking for a certain one.

If you truly want to search, I'd recommend using the search functionality that you can find by clicking the magnifying glass on the lefthand dock.

interesting - thank you for the context jessica~

I'm usually looking for certain files in a particular subspace or in a particular folder, especially for past project or searching for examples in other people's subspaces. the global search doesn't do a good job of this. for example, if I search for `.udf`, the global search wouldn't work well or at all.

Hm yeah I can see that's a gap. We've discussed adding some sort of query language or interface to make it so that you can do more specific searches, but it's not something that we have prioritized. cc @Heymian for visibility here because her team would make those improvements if they were prioritized
Thanks for the flag Jessica, yeah there are a lot of known gaps in our search capabilities/results, but haven’t had time to prioritize the work. I’ll file this as a Jira in the backlog.
